current_observation.observation_time: Last Updated on September 27, 7:41 AM MDT
current_observation.nowcast:
Scattered showers and isolated thunderstorms over portions
of northern Utah will continue through this morning. The
strongest storms at 5:47 am will move over parts of the Cache Valley
area through 7 am. Some of the storms will produce brief
heavy rain...dangerous lightning...and gusty winds.

forecastday.title: Saturday
forecastday.fcttext: Thunderstorms. High 71F. Winds SE at 10 to 15 mph. Chance of rain 90%. Localized flooding is possible.
forecastday.fcttext_metric: Thunderstorms likely. High 22C. Winds SE at 15 to 25 km/h. Chance of rain 90%. Localized flooding is possible.

forecastday.fcttext: Thunderstorms. Low around 55F. N winds shifting to SSW at 10 to 15 mph. Chance of rain 90%.
forecastday.fcttext_metric: Thunderstorms. Low 13C. N winds shifting to SSW at 15 to 25 km/h. Chance of rain 90%.

alerts.message:
...Heat advisory remains in effect until 7 am CDT Saturday...

* temperature...heat indices of 100 to 105 are expected each 
 afternoon...as Max temperatures climb into the mid to upper 
 90s...combined with dewpoints in the mid 60s to around 70. 
 Heat indices will remain in the 75 to 80 degree range at 
 night. 

* Impacts...the hot and humid weather will lead to an increased 
 risk of heat related stress and illnesses. 

Precautionary/preparedness actions...

A heat advisory means that a period of hot temperatures is
expected. The combination of hot temperatures and high humidity
will combine to create a situation in which heat illnesses are
possible. Drink plenty of fluids...stay in an air-conditioned
room...stay out of the sun...and check up on relatives...pets...
neighbors...and livestock.

Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. Know
the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Anyone
overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location.
Heat stroke is an emergency...call 9 1 1.



Mjb
